title: Question 23
prompt:
Sentence 10: Mr. Lombe will also review ideas under development and then he will after that open the floor for additional ideas and comments.

Which is the best way to write the underlined portion of this sentence? If the original is the best way, choose option (A).
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
This sentence is a run-on sentence. It has two independent clauses joined by the conjunction and without a comma. The sentence could be corrected by adding a comma, but this sentence also has some redundant elements. The phrase and “after that” is redundant with “then.” Also, the two independent clauses have the same subject, although the second one uses a pronoun. Both clauses also use the same modal, or helping verb, will. The pronoun and modal can be removed from the second independent clause. This eliminates the need for a comma.
Mr. Lombe will also review ideas under development and then open the floor for additional ideas and comments.
